This site is updating in the open

Things might look a little janky for a bit, but that’s okay! I am in the process of replatforming this site to use Eleventy, as well as refreshing the design. Follow along on GitHub.

Home

Office Hours

I’d like to help give back to an industry that’s given me so much.

What I’m offering

I’m setting aside time on Fridays if you want someone to bounce ideas off of. We can talk about any topic you like, but here’s some subjects I think I might specifically be able to help you out with:

  • Design and design tools
  • User testing and user experience
  • Accessibility
  • Semantics
  • CSS and Sass

Worse comes to worse, I’m an excellent rubber duck.

What I’m not offering

Just to make sure our expectations are aligned: I will not be giving out job or internship offers, or legally binding advice for things like accessibility remediation. I will also not do your work for you, but I will happily help you work through it and point you to relevant resources!

I will hang up on you if you try to sell me something.

Who I’d like to hear from

Anyone of any skill level! This kind of things can seem intimidating, but I'd like to help if I can. If it turns out you know more than me, I’d love the opportunity to learn from you.

I’d especially like to hear from you if you identify with a group that is underrepresented in technology.

How to set up a meeting

Send me an email and we can schedule a time to meet. I like Google Hangouts, but I'm happy to use another service if it is more convenient for you.

For scheduling purposes, I work out of an Eastern United States time zone, typically from 9 to 5. Meetings will last about 15‒30 minutes.
